title: Nude No. 150, New York

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of platinum-palladium print.

inscriptions: Inscribed verso: “3443/..”; inscribed verso: “NUDE 150 / NEW YORK 1949-1950 / ALTERNATE IMAGE / IN BRONZED PLATINUM PALLADIUM [in a box]”; inscribed verso; “PLATINUM-PALLADIUM / PRINT MADE JUNE-JULY 1989 / RIVES PAPER”; inscribed verso: “20/57”; stamped and inscribed verso: “PHOTOGRAPH BY IRVING PENN / Copyright © 1950–RENEWED 1978, COURTESY OF VOGUE / Not to be reproduced without / written permission of / photographer / and THE CONDE NAST PUBLICATIONS INC.”; signed and stamped verso: “Irving Penn / IRVING PENN [in a circle]”; stamped and inscribed verso: “HAND COATED BY THE PHOTOGRAPHER / I.P.”; stamped and inscribed verso: “In addition to 57 numbered prints of this image / in platinum metals, unnumbered, but signed, silver / prints of a similar negative not exceeding a total of 30 may exist.”
publication_history:
Galleria Civica d’Arte Moderna, Turin. 1975. “I platini di Irving Penn: 25 anni di fotografia.” Exh. cat. Galleria Civica d’Arte Moderna/Ages Arti Grafiche. p. 20. (other print of this image)

Foresta, Merry A. and William F. Stapp. 1990. “Irving Penn: Master Images.” Exh. cat. National Museum of American Art and National Portrait Gallery/Smithsonian Institution Press. p. 31, cat. 18. (other print of this image/variant without bronzing)

Hürlimann, Annemarie. 1994. “Irving Penn: Collection privée/Irving Penn: Privatsammlung.” Exh. cat. Musée d’art et d’histoire/Editions Bentali. p. 45, cat. 25. (other print of this image)

Olvey, Maggie and Suzanne Williamson. 1994. "Tradition and the Unpredictable: The Allan Chasanoff Photographic Collection." Exh. cat. Museum of Fine Arts/Distributed Art Publishers. p. 103 (variant). (other print of this image)

Lundström, Jan-Erik. 1995. “Irving Penn fotografier: en donation till mine av Lisa Fonssagrives-Penn/Irving Penn Photographs: A Donation in Memory of Lisa Fonssagrives-Penn.” Exh. cat. Moderna Museet/Raster Förlag. p. 247. (other print of this image/variant without bronzing)

Westerbeck, Colin. 1997. “Irving Penn: A Career in Photography.” Exh. cat. Art Institute of Chicago/Bulfinch Press. p. 77, cat. 57, pl. 28 and back cover.

Hambourg, Maria Morris. 2002. "Earthly Bodies: Irving Penn's Nudes, 1949–50." Exh. cat. Metropolitan Museum of Art/Bulfinch Press. front cover and p. 90. (other print of this image)

Penn, Irving. 2004. “A Notebook at Random.” Bulfinch Press. p. 106. (other print of this image)
exhibition_history: Art Institute of Chicago, “Irving Penn, A Career in Photography,” November 22, 1997–February 1, 1998; traveled to St. Petersburg, Russia, State Hermitage Museum, March 1–May 16, 1998; Hamburg, Germany, Deichtorhallen, June 18–September 6, 1998; Munich, Germany, Müchner Stadtmuseum, October 6, 1998–February 21, 1999; San Francisco, California, Friends of Photography/Ansel Adams Center for Photography, November 11, 1999–January 23, 2000; Museum of Fine Arts, Houston, March 25–June 4, 2000; Paris, France, Maison Européenne de la Photographie, September 13–November 5, 2000. (Colin Westerbeck)
provenance_text: Given by the artist to the Art Institute, 1996.
